intro: Grossera vignei, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
